EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Dear {!Contact.Gender__c} {!Contact.FirstName},
The examination reports for your thesis titled: “Thesis Title”, have been received and are attached for your records.
Sincere congratulations {!Contact.FirstName}, Graduate Education acknowledges the years of hard work you have undertaken.
We are pleased to report that following the inclusion of the listed amendments; the award of degree has been recommended. The necessary steps are listed below.
Step one: address the amendments
A set of amendments to the report(s) must be prepared and approved by your primary supervisor/head of department. To address these, you should:
1. Collect your thermal thesis copies from the Graduate Research Services office between
9.00 am – 5.00 pm (or Research Office Malaysia or Research Office South Africa if
applicable).
2. Complete the recommended amendments and send the following to your supervisor/head of department (CC'd in this email)
a. Summary of your corrections
b. The attached certification form
c. Final (amended) PDF thesis with Monash Preliminary pages (see template) to ensure appropriate copyright notice and declarations have been inserted correctly.
3 A copy of your endorsed certification form email to mge-thesisexams@moansh.edu
Step two: Submit your thesis for archival
Pre-online submission
Once your certification form has been endorsed, you are required to upload the following individual files onto the Monash University Research Repository for Archival at http://arrow.monash.edu.au.
1. PDF Thesis (final copy)
2. A copy of your endorsed certification form
3. A copy of your completed Author Agreement Form (To expedite this, we have attached a copy of the completed author agreement.)
OR (Online submission)
Once your certification form has been endorsed, you are required to upload a final copy of the PDF Thesis on to the Monash University Research Repository for Archival at http://arrow.monash.edu.au.
Step three: Degree ratification
Once we receive confirmation from the Library that your thesis has been successfully archived, your examination file will be presented for ratification.
To expedite the ratification process, final hard-copy theses are no longer required. However, we are happy to ratify any hard-copy theses. To find out how, and where the nearest location is, visit the website.
Some departments/schools still require a final hard-copy thesis, please check with your department/school for their archival requirements.
Due date
The Committee has determined that four weeks from the date of this email is sufficient time to address the amendments. If you are experiencing any delays, you should notify mge-thesisexams@monash.edu.
More information
Graduations: http://www.monash.edu.au/graduations/ WES: To keep your contact details updated, go to the Web Enrolment System WES.
Once again, on behalf of Graduate Education, I would like to congratulate you on your achievement thus far.
Kind regards,
{!Case.OwnerFullName}
